title: MEAS MAT_SCI 301-0-20 Materials Science Principles

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Introduction to processing-structure-property relationship in materials; atomic bonding, typical crystal structures, and use of x-rays to determine crystal structures; imperfections and diffusion; electrical properties of metals and semiconductors; mechanical properties of metals and alloys; phase diagrams; corrosion; ceramics and polymers; magnetic properties; thin films.
Course Outcomes:
A student completing this course will be able to look at materials of different sorts as structures on the atomic level, on the microscopic level and on the macroscopic level and understand:
1) Why atoms, ions and/or molecules assemble into particular crystal structures
2) How these structures dictate certain properties
3) How processing can alter the structures present and their attendant properties
4) How engineering materials are selected for different applications
5) The importance of materials in society

Relationship to Department Objectives:
Supports 1, 2, 3

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Three lectures and one laboratory session per week.
